elpacho1313 wrote:
> Hi I'm new at heritrix but I have real urgency to make it work, here
> some things I need to know:
> 
> I need to obtain a good crawl of 72000 URL's restricted to depth 2 and
> only the text from the page, is Heritrix what I should use???

It can be configured to do what you want; see the TooManyHopsDecideRule 
for limiting the depth and this FAQ entry for limiting to html/text:

http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#midfetch

> I have the problem that Heritrix always seems to take a lot of time to
> crawl the few last queued URL's. Any ideas?

 From your frontier report, it is clear that the target sites are not 
responding, which causes a 'slow retry' (spaced out every 15 minutes) in 
the hopes the problem is a transient network or server issue at the 
destination site.

You can see the connection timeout errors in local-errors.log. If you 
don't want to wait for those sites to maybe come back, you can just 
manually end the crawl. If you simply want the crawler to give up more 
quickly, you can set the number of retries ("max-retries") lower than 
the default 30, and/or the delay between retries ("retry-delay-seconds") 
smaller than the default 900 (15 minutes).

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
